inicio_1.texto: Once upon a time there was a girl named Little Red Riding Hood.
inicio_1.fonetica: wʌns əˈpʌn ə taɪm ðɛɹ wəz ə ɡɝl neɪmd ˈlɪɾəl ˈɹɛd ˈɹaɪdɪŋ hʊd

inicio_2.texto: She lived in a small village surrounded by forest.
inicio_2.fonetica: ʃi lɪvd ɪn ə smɔl ˈvɪlɪdʒ səˈɹaʊndɪd baɪ ˈfɔɹɪst

inicio_3.texto: Everyone loved her for her kindness and cheerful spirit.
inicio_3.fonetica: ˈɛvɹiˌwʌn lʌvd hɝ fɚ hɝ ˈkaɪndnəs ænd ˈtʃɪɹfəl ˈspɪɹɪt

inicio_4.texto: One day her mother asked her for an important favor.
inicio_4.fonetica: wʌn deɪ hɝ ˈmʌðɚ æskt hɝ fɚ ən ɪmˈpɔɹtənt ˈfeɪvɚ

inicio_5.texto: She needed her to take a basket of food to Grandma.
inicio_5.fonetica: ʃi ˈnidɪd hɝ tə teɪk ə ˈbæskɪt əv fud tə ˈɡɹændmɑ

inicio_6.texto: Grandma was sick and needed some care.
inicio_6.fonetica: ˈɡɹændmɑ wəz sɪk ænd ˈnidɪd sʌm kɛɹ

inicio_7.texto: Her mother warned her not to leave the path.
inicio_7.fonetica: hɝ ˈmʌðɚ wɔɹnd hɝ nɑt tə liv ðə pæθ

inicio_8.texto: She also told her not to speak with strangers.
inicio_8.fonetica: ʃi ˈɔlsoʊ toʊld hɝ nɑt tə spiːk wɪð ˈstreɪndʒɚz

inicio_9.texto: Little Red promised to follow her mother’s directions.
inicio_9.fonetica: ˈlɪɾəl ɹɛd ˈprɑməst tə ˈfɑloʊ hɝ ˈmʌðɚz dəˈɹɛkʃənz

inicio_10.texto: She took the basket and started down the forest path.
inicio_10.fonetica: ʃi tʊk ðə ˈbæskɪt ænd ˈstɑɹtɪd daʊn ðə ˈfɔɹəst pæθ

camino_11.texto: The sun was shining and birds were singing in the trees.
camino_11.fonetica: ðə sʌn wəz ˈʃaɪnɪŋ ænd bɝdz wɝ ˈsɪŋɪŋ ɪn ðə tɹiz

camino_12.texto: The girl stopped to admire some bright red flowers.
camino_12.fonetica: ðə ɡɝl stɑpt tə ædˈmaɪɹ sʌm bɹaɪt ɹɛd ˈflaʊɚz

camino_13.texto: She remembered her mother’s words and kept going.
camino_13.fonetica: ʃi ɹɪˈmɛmbɚd hɝ ˈmʌðɚz wɝdz ænd kɛpt ˈɡoʊɪŋ

camino_14.texto: Suddenly she heard a rustle behind the bushes.
camino_14.fonetica: ˈsʌdənli ʃi hɝd ə ˈɹʌsəl bɪˈhaɪnd ðə ˈbʊʃɪz

camino_15.texto: A huge wolf appeared in the middle of the path.
camino_15.fonetica: ə hjudʒ wʊlf əˈpɪɹd ɪn ðə ˈmɪdəl əv ðə pæθ

dialogo_16.texto: The wolf greeted her with a sly smile.
dialogo_16.fonetica: ðə wʊlf ˈɡɹitɪd hɝ wɪð ə slaɪ smaɪl

dialogo_17.texto: “Good morning, little one, where are you heading?” he asked.
dialogo_17.fonetica: ɡʊd ˈmɔrnɪŋ ˈlɪɾəl wʌn wɛɹ ɑɹ ju ˈhɛdɪŋ hi æskt

dialogo_18.texto: “I’m going to my grandma’s house on the other side of the forest,” she replied.
dialogo_18.fonetica: aɪm ˈɡoʊɪŋ tə maɪ ˈɡɹændmɑz haʊs ɑn ði ˈʌðɚ saɪd əv ðə ˈfɔɹəst ʃi ɹɪˈplaɪd

dialogo_19.texto: The wolf pretended to be interested and grinned wider.
dialogo_19.fonetica: ðə wʊlf pɹɪˈtɛndɪd tə bi ˈɪntɹəstɪd ænd ɡɹɪnd ˈwaɪdɚ

dialogo_20.texto: He suggested she pick a few flowers to brighten Grandma’s day.
dialogo_20.fonetica: hi səɡˈdʒɛstɪd ʃi pɪk ə fju ˈflaʊɚz tə ˈbɹaɪtn ˈɡɹændmɑz deɪ

dialogo_21.texto: Little Red Riding Hood agreed to the idea without suspecting a thing.
dialogo_21.fonetica: ˈlɪɾəl ɹɛd ˈɹaɪdɪŋ hʊd əˈɡɹid tə ði aɪˈdiə wɪˈðaʊt səˈspɛktɪŋ ə ˈθɪŋ

dialogo_22.texto: She bent down to pick the prettiest flowers.
dialogo_22.fonetica: ʃi bɛnt daʊn tə pɪk ðə ˈprɪtiəst ˈflaʊɚz

dialogo_23.texto: Meanwhile, the wolf came up with a quick plan.
dialogo_23.fonetica: ˈmiˌnwaɪl ðə wʊlf keɪm ʌp wɪð ə kwɪk plæn

dialogo_24.texto: He ran along a shortcut to reach Grandma’s house first.
dialogo_24.fonetica: hi ɹæn əˈlɔŋ ə ˈʃɔɹtˌkʊt tə ɹiʧ ˈɡɹændmɑz haʊs fɝst

dialogo_25.texto: He knocked softly on the door.
dialogo_25.fonetica: hi nɑkt ˈsɔf(t)li ɑn ðə dɔɹ

dialogo_27.texto: The wolf pretended to be Little Red’s voice.
dialogo_27.fonetica: ðə wʊlf pɹɪˈtɛndɪd tə bi ˈlɪɾəl ɹɛdz vɔɪs

dialogo_28.texto: It’s me, Grandma, he said sweetly.
dialogo_28.fonetica: ɪts mi ˈɡɹændmɑ hi sɛd ˈswitli

dialogo_29.texto: Grandma told him to come in.
dialogo_29.fonetica: ˈɡɹændmɑ toʊld hɪm tə kʌm ɪn

dialogo_30.texto: The wolf stepped inside and shut the door with a leap.
dialogo_30.fonetica: ðə wʊlf stɛpt ɪnˈsaɪd ənd ʃʌt ðə dɔɹ wɪð ə lip

engaño_31.texto: He pounced on Grandma and locked her in the closet.
engaño_31.fonetica: hi paʊnst ɑn ˈɡɹændmɑ ənd lɑkt hɝ ɪn ðə ˈklɑzɪt

engaño_32.texto: Then he put on her cap and glasses.
engaño_32.fonetica: ðɛn hi pʊt ɑn hɝ kæp ənd ˈɡlæsɪz

engaño_33.texto: He slipped into the bed to wait for Little Red.
engaño_33.fonetica: hi slɪpt ˈɪntu ðə bɛd tə weɪt fɔɹ ˈlɪɾəl ɹɛd

camino_34.texto: Meanwhile, Little Red kept picking flowers.
camino_34.fonetica: ˈmiˌnwaɪl ˈlɪɾəl ɹɛd kɛpt ˈpɪkɪŋ ˈflaʊɚz

camino_35.texto: She remembered her mother’s warning again.
camino_35.fonetica: ʃi ɹɪˈmɛmbɚd hɝ ˈmʌðɚz ˈwɔrnɪŋ əˈɡɛn

camino_36.texto: She realized it was getting late.
camino_36.fonetica: ʃi ˈɹiəˌlaɪzd ɪt wʌz ˈɡɛtɪŋ leɪt

encuentro_38.texto: When she arrived, she noticed the door was ajar.
encuentro_38.fonetica: wɛn ʃi əˈraɪvd ʃi ˈnoʊtɪst ðə dɔɹ wʌz əˈʤɑɹ

encuentro_39.texto: The house was quiet and a little dark.
encuentro_39.fonetica: ðə haʊs wʌz ˈkwaɪət ənd ə ˈlɪɾl dɑɹk

dialogo_41.texto: She walked up to Grandma’s bed with curiosity.
dialogo_41.fonetica: ʃi wɔkt ʌp tə ˈɡɹændmɑz bɛd wɪð ˌkjʊɹiˈɑsɪti

dialogo_42.texto: She saw Grandma covered up to her head.
dialogo_42.fonetica: ʃi sɔ ˈɡɹændmɑ ˈkʌvɚd ʌp tə hɝ hɛd

dialogo_43.texto: Grandma, what big eyes you have, said Little Red.
dialogo_43.fonetica: ˈɡɹændmɑ wʌt bɪɡ aɪz ju hæv sɛd ˈlɪɾəl ɹɛd

dialogo_44.texto: The better to see you with, replied the disguised wolf.
dialogo_44.fonetica: ðə ˈbɛtɚ tə si ju wɪð ɹɪˈplaɪd ðə dɪsˈɡaɪzd wʊlf

dialogo_45.texto: Grandma, what big ears you have.
dialogo_45.fonetica: ˈɡɹændmɑ wʌt bɪɡ ɪɹz ju hæv

dialogo_46.texto: The better to hear you with, answered the wolf.
dialogo_46.fonetica: ðə ˈbɛtɚ tə hɪɹ ju wɪð ˈænsɚd ðə wʊlf

dialogo_47.texto: Grandma, what sharp teeth you have.
dialogo_47.fonetica: ˈɡɹændmɑ wʌt ʃɑɹp tiθ ju hæv

dialogo_48.texto: The better to eat you with, growled the wolf as he leapt from the bed.
dialogo_48.fonetica: ðə ˈbɛtɚ tu it ju wɪð ɡɹaʊld ðə wʊlf æz hi lɛpt frəm ðə bɛd

dialogo_49.texto: Little Red screamed with all her might.
dialogo_49.fonetica: ˈlɪɾəl ɹɛd skɹimd wɪð ɑl hɝ maɪt

dialogo_50.texto: A hunter passing by heard the scream.
dialogo_50.fonetica: ə ˈhʌntɚ ˈpæsɪŋ baɪ hɝd ðə skɹim

dialogo_51.texto: He ran quickly toward the house.
dialogo_51.fonetica: hi ɹæn ˈkwɪkli təˈwɔɹd ðə haʊs

dialogo_52.texto: He entered and saw the wolf trying to catch the girl.
dialogo_52.fonetica: hi ˈɛntɚd ənd sɑ ðə wʊlf ˈtɹaɪɪŋ tə kætʃ ðə ɡɝl

dialogo_53.texto: The hunter aimed his rifle and shouted loudly.
dialogo_53.fonetica: ðə ˈhʌntɚ eɪmd hɪz ˈraɪfəl ənd ˈʃaʊtɪd ˈlaʊdli

dialogo_55.texto: The wolf got scared and let Little Red go.
dialogo_55.fonetica: ðə wʊlf ɡɑt skɛɹd ənd lɛt ˈlɪɾəl ɹɛd ɡoʊ

dialogo_56.texto: The hunter managed to trap him with a net.
dialogo_56.fonetica: ðə ˈhʌntɚ ˈmænɪʤd tə tɹæp hɪm wɪð ə nɛt

dialogo_57.texto: Little Red hugged the hunter gratefully.
dialogo_57.fonetica: ˈlɪɾəl ɹɛd hʌɡd ðə ˈhʌntɚ ˈɡreɪtfəli

dialogo_58.texto: They searched for Grandma and found her safe in the closet.
dialogo_58.fonetica: ðeɪ sɝʧt fɚ ˈɡɹændmɑ ənd faʊnd hɝ seɪf ɪn ðə ˈklɑzɪt

dialogo_59.texto: Grandma came out relieved and happy.
dialogo_59.fonetica: ˈɡɹændmɑ keɪm aʊt ɹɪˈlivd ənd ˈhæpi

dialogo_60.texto: Everyone celebrated that the danger had passed.
dialogo_60.fonetica: ˈɛvɹiˌwʌn ˈsɛləˌbɹeɪtɪd ðæt ðə ˈdeɪnʤɚ hæd pæst

final_61.texto: Grandma thanked the hunter for his bravery.
final_61.fonetica: ˈɡɹæn.mɑː θæŋkt ðə ˈhʌn.tɚ fɚ hɪz ˈbreɪ.vɚ.i

final_62.texto: Little Red promised never to leave the path again.
final_62.fonetica: ˈlɪɾ.əl ɹɛd ˈprɑː.mɪst ˈnɛv.ɚ tə liv ðə pæθ əˈɡɛn

final_63.texto: The hunter advised them both to be more careful.
final_63.fonetica: ðə ˈhʌn.tɚ ədˈvaɪzd ðəm boʊθ tə bi mɔɹ ˈkɛɹ.fəl

final_64.texto: The wolf was taken far from the forest to never return.
final_64.fonetica: ðə wʊlf wəz ˈteɪ.kən fɑɹ frəm ðə ˈfɔɹ.ɪst tə ˈnɛv.ɚ ɹɪˈtɝn

final_65.texto: Grandma served warm tea for everyone.
final_65.fonetica: ˈɡɹæn.mɑː sɝvd wɔɹm ti fɚ ˈɛv.ɹi.wʌn

final_66.texto: Little Red recounted the adventure with excitement.
final_66.fonetica: ˈlɪɾ.əl ɹɛd ɹɪˈkaʊn.tɪd ði ədˈvɛn.tʃɚ wɪð ɪkˈsaɪt.mənt

final_67.texto: The hunter listened, smiling and nodding.
final_67.fonetica: ðə ˈhʌn.tɚ ˈlɪs.ənd ˈsmaɪ.lɪŋ ænd ˈnɑː.dɪŋ

final_68.texto: Grandma gently stroked her granddaughter’s hair.
final_68.fonetica: ˈɡɹæn.mɑː ˈdʒɛn.tli stɹoʊkt hɚ ˈɡɹæn.dɔː.tɚz hɛɹ

final_69.texto: They promised to visit each other more often.
final_69.fonetica: ðeɪ ˈprɑː.mɪst tə ˈvɪ.zɪt itʃ ˈʌð.ɚ mɔɹ ˈɔf.ən

final_70.texto: The sun began to set over the forest.
final_70.fonetica: ðə sʌn bɪˈɡæn tə sɛt ˈoʊ.vɚ ðə ˈfɔɹ.ɪst

final_71.texto: Little Red and the hunter started their journey home.
final_71.fonetica: ˈlɪɾ.əl ɹɛd ænd ðə ˈhʌn.tɚ ˈstɑɹ.tɪd ðɛɹ ˈdʒɝ.ni hoʊm

final_72.texto: The girl admired the colors of the sunset.
final_72.fonetica: ðə ɡɝl ədˈmaɪɚd ðə ˈkʌl.ɚz əv ðə ˈsʌn.sɛt

final_73.texto: She remembered the lessons learned that day.
final_73.fonetica: ʃi ɹɪˈmɛm.bɚd ðə ˈlɛs.ənz lɝnd ðæt deɪ

final_74.texto: She would never trust strangers in the woods again.
final_74.fonetica: ʃi wʊd ˈnɛv.ɚ tɹʌst ˈstreɪn.dʒɚz ɪn ðə wʊdz əˈɡɛn

final_75.texto: Her mother waited anxiously at the door.
final_75.fonetica: hɚ ˈmʌð.ɚ ˈweɪ.tɪd ˈæŋk.ʃəs.li æt ðə dɔɹ

final_76.texto: Seeing her, she ran to hug her tightly.
final_76.fonetica: ˈsi.ɪŋ hɚ, ʃi ɹæn tə hʌɡ hɚ ˈtaɪt.li

final_77.texto: Little Red told everything that had happened in detail.
final_77.fonetica: ˈlɪɾ.əl ɹɛd toʊld ˈɛv.ɹi.θɪŋ ðæt həd ˈhæp.ənd ɪn ˈdi.teɪl

final_78.texto: Her mother praised her for her bravery.
final_78.fonetica: hɚ ˈmʌð.ɚ preɪzd hɚ fɚ hɚ ˈbreɪ.vɚ.i

final_79.texto: They both thanked the hunter from the heart.
final_79.fonetica: ðeɪ boʊθ θæŋkt ðə ˈhʌn.tɚ frəm ðə hɑɹt

final_80.texto: From that day on, Little Red always remembered to obey her mother.
final_80.fonetica: frəm ðæt deɪ ɑn, ˈlɪɾ.əl ɹɛd ˈɔl.weɪz ɹɪˈmɛm.bɚd tə oʊˈbeɪ hɚ ˈmʌð.ɚ

epilogo_81.texto: The hunter returned to his cabin after escorting the girl.
epilogo_81.fonetica: ðə ˈhʌn.tɚ ɹɪˈtɝnd tə hɪz ˈkæb.ɪn ˈæf.tɚ ɛˈskɔɹ.tɪŋ ðə ɡɝl

epilogo_82.texto: He thought about the importance of protecting the forest.
epilogo_82.fonetica: hi θɔt əˈbaʊt ði ɪmˈpɔɹ.təns əv pɹəˈtɛk.tɪŋ ðə ˈfɔɹ.ɪst

epilogo_83.texto: Grandma rested peacefully in her bed.
epilogo_83.fonetica: ˈɡɹæn.mɑː ˈɹɛs.tɪd ˈpis.fə.li ɪn hɚ bɛd

epilogo_84.texto: She remembered the fright she had experienced.
epilogo_84.fonetica: ʃi ɹɪˈmɛm.bɚd ðə fɹaɪt ʃi həd ɪkˈspɪɹ.iənst

epilogo_85.texto: Little Red helped her mother prepare dinner.
epilogo_85.fonetica: ˈlɪɾ.əl ɹɛd hɛlpt hɚ ˈmʌð.ɚ pɹɪˈpɛɹ ˈdɪn.ɚ

epilogo_86.texto: While they cooked, they talked about what had happened.
epilogo_86.fonetica: waɪl ðeɪ kʊkt, ðeɪ tɔkt əˈbaʊt wʌt həd ˈhæpənd

epilogo_87.texto: Her mother reminded her of the value of obedience.
epilogo_87.fonetica: hɚ ˈmʌð.ɚ ɹɪˈmaɪndɪd hɚ əv ðə ˈvæl.ju əv oʊˈbi.di.əns

epilogo_88.texto: Little Red promised to always be cautious.
epilogo_88.fonetica: ˈlɪɾ.əl ɹɛd ˈprɑː.mɪst tu ˈɔl.weɪz bi ˈkɔ.ʃəs

epilogo_89.texto: Night arrived with a sky full of stars.
epilogo_89.fonetica: naɪt əˈɹaɪvd wɪð ə skaɪ fʊl əv stɑɹz

epilogo_90.texto: The family shared a happy dinner together.
epilogo_90.fonetica: ðə ˈfæm.ə.li ʃɛɹd ə ˈhæp.i ˈdɪn.ɚ təˈɡɛð.ɚ

epilogo_91.texto: The forest lay silent under the moon.
epilogo_91.fonetica: ðə ˈfɔɹ.ɪst leɪ ˈsaɪ.lənt ˈʌndɚ ðə mun

epilogo_93.texto: Far away, the wolf reflected on his defeat.
epilogo_93.fonetica: fɑɹ əˈweɪ, ðə wʊlf ɹɪˈflɛk.tɪd ɑn hɪz dɪˈfit

epilogo_94.texto: He understood that evil always brings consequences.
epilogo_94.fonetica: hi ˌʌndɚˈstʊd ðæt ˈi.vəl ˈɔl.weɪz bɹɪŋz ˈkɑn.sə.kwəns.ɪz

epilogo_95.texto: Little Red fell asleep with a relieved smile.
epilogo_95.fonetica: ˈlɪɾ.əl ɹɛd fɛl əˈslip wɪð ə ɹɪˈlivd smaɪl

epilogo_96.texto: She dreamed of peaceful days in the forest.
epilogo_96.fonetica: ʃi dɹimd əv ˈpis.fəl deɪz ɪn ðə ˈfɔɹ.ɪst

epilogo_97.texto: Her mother tucked her in with love.
epilogo_97.fonetica: hɚ ˈmʌð.ɚ tʌkt hɚ ɪn wɪð lʌv

epilogo_98.texto: Grandma, from her home, also thought of them.
epilogo_98.fonetica: ˈɡɹæn.mɑː frəm hɚ hoʊm ˈɔl.soʊ θɔt əv ðɛm

epilogo_99.texto: The hunter gazed at the stars before sleeping.
epilogo_99.fonetica: ðə ˈhʌn.tɚ ɡeɪzd ət ðə stɑɹz bɪˈfɔɹ ˈsli.pɪŋ

epilogo_100.texto: Thus ended a day full of lessons for everyone.
epilogo_100.fonetica: ðʌs ˈɛndɪd ə deɪ fʊl əv ˈlɛs.ənz fɚ ˈɛv.ɹi.wʌn

epilogo_101.texto: The sunrise painted the forest trees in golden light.
epilogo_101.fonetica: ðə ˈsʌnˌraɪz ˈpeɪn.tɪd ðə ˈfɔɹ.ɪst tɹiz ɪn ˈɡoʊl.dən laɪt

epilogo_102.texto: The birds began their morning song.
epilogo_102.fonetica: ðə bɝdz bɪˈɡæn ðɛɹ ˈmɔɹ.nɪŋ sɔŋ

epilogo_103.texto: Little Red woke up full of energy.
epilogo_103.fonetica: ˈlɪɾ.əl ɹɛd woʊk ʌp fʊl əv ˈɛn.ɚ.dʒi

epilogo_104.texto: She remembered her brave friend, the hunter, with gratitude.
epilogo_104.fonetica: ʃi ɹɪˈmɛm.bɚd hɚ breɪv fɹɛnd ðə ˈhʌn.tɚ wɪð ˈɡɹæt.əˌtud

epilogo_105.texto: Her mother prepared a special breakfast for her.
epilogo_105.fonetica: hɚ ˈmʌð.ɚ pɹɪˈpɛɹd ə ˈspɛʃ.əl ˈbɹɛk.fəst fɔɹ hɚ

epilogo_106.texto: While they ate, they talked about plans for the day.
epilogo_106.fonetica: waɪl ðeɪ eɪt, ðeɪ tɔkt əˈbaʊt plænz fɚ ðə deɪ

epilogo_107.texto: They decided to visit Grandma again in a few days.
epilogo_107.fonetica: ðeɪ dɪˈsaɪdɪd tə ˈvɪz.ɪt ˈɡɹæn.mɑː əˈɡɛn ɪn ə fju deɪz

epilogo_108.texto: They wanted to make sure everything was alright.
epilogo_108.fonetica: ðeɪ ˈwɑn.tɪd tə meɪk ʃʊɹ ˈɛv.ɹiˌθɪŋ wəz ɔlˈɹaɪt

epilogo_110.texto: She knitted a scarf while thinking of her granddaughter.
epilogo_110.fonetica: ʃi ˈnɪtɪd ə skɑɹf waɪl ˈθɪŋ.kɪŋ əv hɚ ˈɡrænˌdɔtɚ

epilogo_111.texto: The sun lit the cabin with warm light.
epilogo_111.fonetica: ðə sʌn lɪt ðə ˈkæb.ɪn wɪð wɔɹm laɪt

epilogo_112.texto: The forest breathed peace after the adventure.
epilogo_112.fonetica: ðə ˈfɔɹ.ɪst briðd pis ˈæf.tɚ ði ədˈvɛn.tʃɚ

epilogo_113.texto: Animals played happily among the trees.
epilogo_113.fonetica: ˈæn.ə.məlz pleɪd ˈhæp.ə.li əˈmʌŋ ðə tɹiz

epilogo_114.texto: Little Red went to the garden to pick flowers.
epilogo_114.fonetica: ˈlɪɾ.əl ɹɛd wɛnt tə ðə ˈɡɑɹ.dən tə pɪk ˈflaʊ.ɚz

epilogo_115.texto: She thought about how nature always offers beauty.
epilogo_115.fonetica: ʃi θɔt əˈbaʊt haʊ ˈneɪ.tʃɚ ˈɔl.weɪz ˈɔf.ɚz ˈbjuː.ti

epilogo_116.texto: She decided every walk would be taken with care and respect.
epilogo_116.fonetica: ʃi dɪˈsaɪdɪd ˈɛv.ɹi wɔk wʊd bi ˈteɪ.kən wɪð kɛɹ ənd ɹɪˈspɛkt

epilogo_117.texto: Her mother smiled when she saw her so thoughtful.
epilogo_117.fonetica: hɚ ˈmʌð.ɚ smaɪld wɛn ʃi sɑ hɚ soʊ ˈθɔt.fəl

epilogo_118.texto: Both knew that day had changed their lives.
epilogo_118.fonetica: boʊθ nu ðæt deɪ həd tʃeɪndʒd ðɛɹ laɪvz

epilogo_119.texto: The memory of the adventure remained as an endless lesson.
epilogo_119.fonetica: ðə ˈmɛm.ɚ.i əv ði ədˈvɛn.tʃɚ ɹɪˈmeɪnd æz æn ˈɛnd.ləs ˈlɛs.ən

epilogo_120.texto: And so ends the story of brave Little Red Riding Hood.
epilogo_120.fonetica: ænd soʊ ɛndz ðə ˈstɔɹ.i əv breɪv ˈlɪɾ.əl ɹɛd ˈraɪ.dɪŋ hʊd
